qas.question: When did Carrion Jr. retire as Borough President?
When was Carrion Jr. first elected Borough President?
When was Carrion Jr. re-elected Borough President?

context: Until <a0_0>March 1, 2009<a0_0/>, the Borough President of the Bronx was Adolfo Carrión Jr., elected as a Democrat in <a1_0>2001<a1_0/> and <a2_0>2005<a2_0/> before retiring early to direct the White House Office of Urban Affairs Policy. His successor, Democratic New York State Assembly member <a3_0>Rubén Díaz, Jr.<a3_0/>, who won a special election on <a4_0>April 21, 2009<a4_0/> by a vote of 86.3% (29,420) on the "Bronx Unity" line to 13.3% (4,646) for the Republican district leader Anthony Ribustello on the "People First" line, became Borough President on May 1.
